line_1: Or fills the golden ear of Wheat,
line_2: Gives to the Rose such balmy sweet,

line_1: Tho' one would save ye, not one Grain of Wheat
line_2: Shou'd pay such Songsters idling at my Gate.

line_1: In labour'd Furrows sow the Choice of Wheat,
line_2: And over empty Sheaves in Harvest sweat:

line_1: And spang o'er my fields o' new wheat,
line_2: Can ony man tell me that's reet?

line_1: In winter! I'll winnow the wheat
line_2: That flail will be music as sweet

line_1: Ants prudent bite the Ends of hoarded Wheat,
line_2: Lest growing Seeds their future Hopes defeat;
